{{Refimprove|date=October 2008}} {{Infobox software | title = Liero | logo = | author=Joosa Riekkinen | developer = Erik Lindroos and community | released = {{Start date and age|1998|01|01}} | latest_release_version = 1.33 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|1999|01|01|df=yes}} | latest preview version = 1.36 | latest preview date = {{Start date and age|2016|03|05|df=yes}} | genre = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]]/[[Multiplayer video game|Multiplayer]] [[Action game]] | platform = [[crossplatform]] (originally [[MS-DOS]]) | website = {{URL|http://www.liero.be/}} | license = [[WTFPL]]
}} [[File:LieroGameplay.png|thumb|right|256px|Screenshot of Liero. The player is using the ninja rope to hang from a clump of dirt while shooting at the enemy with rockets.]]
'''''Liero''''' is a [[video game]] for [[MS-DOS]], first released by [[Finland|Finnish]] programmer Joosa Riekkinen in 1998. The game has been described as a [[Real-time computer graphics|real-time]] version of ''[[Worms (game)|Worms]]'' (a turn-based [[Artillery game]]).<ref name="Hotu"/> ''Liero'' is [[Finnish language|Finnish]] for [[earthworm]] and is pronounced {{IPA-fi|liero|}}. Inspired itself by the earlier game ''MoleZ'',<ref name="molez"/> Liero provided inspiration for the later game ''[[Soldat (video game)|Soldat]]''.
==Gameplay== In ''Liero'', two worms fight each other to death for score (or [[Glossary_of_video_game_terms#frag|frag]]s) using a choice of five weapons from a total of 40 in a two-dimensional map. Most of the terrain, except for indestructible rocks, may be dug or destroyed by explosions. In addition to the weaponry, each player has a ninja rope which can be used to move faster through the map. This grappling hook-like device substitutes for jetpacks and can even latch onto the enemy worm to drag him closer to his foe.
While playing, there are health power-ups to heal your worm. It is also possible to replace one of your five weapons by picking up bonuses. Before playing, you can select certain weapons to be available only in bonuses, in the entire game, or completely disabled.
Unlike most side-scrolling deathmatch games, the weapons in ''Liero'' have infinite ammo. Key factors include the reload rate of each weapon and how fast they shoot, whereas in most others include how much ammo a gun sports and how frequent more ammo for that gun can be found. ''Liero'' depends all on timing and swift maneuverability.
The gameplay mode can be [[deathmatch (gaming)|deathmatch]], Game of Tag or [[Capture the flag#Software games|Capture the Flag]]. It can be played by two human players simultaneously in [[split screen (computer graphics)|split screen]] or in a single player mode against the game's [[artificial intelligence]], although the game's popularity is derived mostly from the fast-paced player-vs.-player action it provides.
==Development history==
=== Original Liero by Joosa Riekkinen === Joosa Riekkinen developed Liero as DOS game with the first version released in 1998. Liero was inspired by the previous [[Freeware]] game MoleZ, and took many weapons and sounds from its precursor.<ref name="molez">[http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=MoleZ Liero Wiki: MoleZ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070324194207/http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=MoleZ |date=March 24, 2007 }}</ref> The original Liero's latest version was 1.33, which was released in 1999.<ref name="official Liero wiki">[http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero official Liero wiki] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090121184806/http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero |date=January 21, 2009 }}</ref><ref>[http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero_1.33 official Liero wiki about Liero 1.33] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070326152656/http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero_1.33 |date=March 26, 2007 }}</ref> However, the author lost the [[Pascal (programming language)|Pascal]] [[source code]] in a [[hard disk]] crash, and due to the lack of backup, no new "classic" versions have been released since.<ref name="official Liero wiki"/>
===Community developments === Despite this, and with the author's approval, the ''Liero'' community has distributed several altered (or [[Hacker (hobbyist)|hack]]ed) versions of the game through the LieroCDC, and others.<ref>[http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero#Modability official Liero wiki about modability] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090121184806/http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero#Modability |date=January 21, 2009 }}</ref>
=== Merge === In 2009, "classic" Liero was officially merged<ref>See the changes.txt file in Liero 1.34 or newer.</ref> with the OpenLiero project upon the release of Liero 1.34 (not to be confused with the [[total conversion]] by that name). The new versions are released by Gliptic, although Joosa Riekkinen endorses them as official. The original Liero data and binary files by Joosa Riekkinen were released available under the [[WTFPL]] [[Software license|license]].<ref>[http://www.liero.be/download/liero-1.36-bundle.zip license.txt] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305140145/http://www.liero.be/download/liero-1.36-bundle.zip |date=2016-03-05 }} on www.liero.be ''"The original Liero data and binary files are copyright 1998 Joosa Riekkinen They are, unless otherwise stated, available under the WTFPL license: {{cite web |url=http://sam.zoy.org/wtfpl/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-05-25 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/668YoS4r0?url=http://sam.zoy.org/wtfpl/ |archivedate=2012-03-13 |df= }} The LIERO.EXE binary contains the SMIX sound library: {{cite web |url=http://homepages.cae.wisc.edu/~brodskye/smix/smix.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-07-16 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160502152155/http://homepages.cae.wisc.edu/~brodskye/smix/smix.html |archivedate=2016-05-02 |df= }} The author of SMIX has stated that it is available under a BSD-3-Clause license, with a request for donations for use in commercial products. LIERO.SND contains sounds from Molez: {{cite web |url=http://www.fractilegames.com/product.php?id=molez |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-04-02 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110810132119/http://www.fractilegames.com/product.php?id=molez |archivedate=2011-08-10 |df= }} Molez is freeware and freely distributable."''</ref>
Liero's last release was version 1.36, release September 3, 2013.<ref name="TIG136"/> This version is compatible with almost any OS but lacks network gaming (unlike some of the remakes).
==Clones, remakes and derivatives==
==={{anchor|OpenLieroX}}Liero Xtreme=== '''''Liero Xtreme''''' (often called '''''LieroX''''', '''''Liero Extreme''''' or just '''''LX''''') is a [[2D computer graphics|2D]] [[shooter game]]. It is an unofficial sequel to ''Liero'', and is the most popular of all the Liero clones.<ref name="bigdownload">{{cite web|url=http://news.bigdownload.com/2009/09/04/freeware-friday-openlierox/|work=Big Download|publisher=Game Daily|title=Freeware Friday: OpenLieroX|author=James Murff|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150130215051/http://news.bigdownload.com/2009/09/04/freeware-friday-openlierox/|archivedate=2015-01-30|df=}}</ref><ref name="Lanthrax">{{cite web|url=http://www.lanthrax.com/news_details.asp?NewsID=01381|title=OpenLieroX review|work=LANThrax|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160105040840/http://www.lanthrax.com/news_details.asp?NewsID=01381|archivedate=2016-01-05|df=}}</ref><ref>[http://tigsource.com/articles/2008/05/14/multiplayer-on-one-keyboard-6-lier-um-yeah Liero review with side note about OpenLieroX] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100202054332/http://tigsource.com/articles/2008/05/14/multiplayer-on-one-keyboard-6-lier-um-yeah |date=2010-02-02 }}</ref><ref>[http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero_Xtreme Liero Xtreme entry in official Liero wiki] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090121184852/http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero_Xtreme |date=January 21, 2009 }}</ref><ref name="eGamer about OpenLieroX">[http://egamer.co.za/2009/07/egamer-on-some-great-minigames/ eGamer about OpenLieroX] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121112104734/http://egamer.co.za/2009/07/egamer-on-some-great-minigames/ |date=2012-11-12 }}</ref> It features [[online play]], fully customizable weapons, levels and characters. Liero Xtreme was created in [[C++]] by Jason 'JasonB' Boettcher, an [[Australia]]n programmer.<ref name="Lanthrax"/> With its source release on April 10, 2006, a new project has become available on October 24, 2006, known as '''''OpenLieroX''''',<ref name="Lanthrax"/> while the development of the original LieroX project has stopped. At the time of writing (May 6, 2009), OpenLieroX has tripled in code size<ref>[https://www.ohloh.net/p/6596/analyses/latest Ohloh statistics of OpenLieroX]</ref> and has many new features.<ref name="bigdownload"/><ref>[http://www.root.cz/clanky/openlierox-nebezpecni-cervici/ Czech review of OpenLieroX] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303183331/http://www.root.cz/clanky/openlierox-nebezpecni-cervici/ |date=2016-03-03 }}</ref><ref>[http://openlierox.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/openlierox/doc/ChangeLog?view=markup Change log of all OpenLieroX releases]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
The game is based on a [[Deathmatch (gaming)|deathmatch]] setting, where multiple players face off in a closed [[Level (computer and video games)|level]]. Each player is equipped with five weapons selected out of all the weapons allowed, and with a ''ninja rope'' that allows the player to move in any direction. Players begin with a set amount of lives, and whilst the game records the number of kills, the [[Last man standing (gaming)|last man standing]] is usually considered the winner. Liero Xtreme also allows team deathmatches, which has made it common for players to form [[Clan (computer gaming)|clans]]. OpenLieroX runs on Windows, on MacOSX, on Linux and on FreeBSD.
The first release announcement of Liero Extreme was made on October 14, 2002.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20050826034655/http://liero.suddenlaunch2.com/index.cgi?board=LSeq&action=display&num=1034607561 Webarchiv of Liero Extreme original release post of Jason Boettcher]</ref> LieroX has become very famous over the time. On February 14, 2006, ''Jason Boettcher'' stopped the LieroX development for good. The last version he released was 0.62b, which had many new features, but suffered from crashes and various errors, and did not catch on within the community which continues to play the 0.56b version. Before leaving the community, he released the [[source code]] of the even older version 0.55b under the [[Zlib License|zlib license]].<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20110716235955/http://www.thegaminguniverse.com/forums/showthread.php?t=28565 Original post by Jason Boettcher]</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20151017081758/http://openlierox.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/openlierox/doc/original_source_release/?pathrev=3042 Notes of original source release]</ref> Development of LieroXtreme is now in hands of Karel Petranek and Albert Zeyer, used the source code to create OpenLieroX, which is compatible with the popular 0.56b version, but has multiple new features and bugfixes.<ref>[http://openlierox.sourceforge.net Official OpenLieroX homepage] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091003121123/http://openlierox.sourceforge.net/ |date=2009-10-03 }}</ref> Michał Futer took care of the new frontend. Currently the majority of players play OpenLieroX.
As a customizable game, it allows players and developers to [[Scripting language|script]] their own [[Mod (computer gaming)|mods]]. Different mods have different sets of unique weapons, and may also differ in player gravity and movement. The default mod is ''Liero 1.0'', also called ''Classic'', which is roughly equal to the basic setting in original Liero. On top of this, several player-created mods are included in the standard game packs, some of which are more popular than the default setting. Similarly to Liero, the default level is ''Dirt Level'', consisting of diggable terrain with some indestructible rock. The default level is comparatively rarely played compared to more complex player-created levels.
The game interface allow players to modify factors of the game such as which weapons in a mod are allowed, and how fast they reload and many other parameters which have huge impact on the game play.
===NiL=== [[File:Nil.png|right|thumb|Screenshot of NiL]] '''''NiL''''' ([[recursive acronym]] for ''NiL Isn't Liero'') is a [[Video game clone|clone]] of '''Liero''', which runs on [[Linux]] and [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and is released under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]]. NiL is not limited to two players, like the original ''Liero'' is. It has support for an infinite{{Citation needed|date=December 2017}} number of players over a [[Transmission Control Protocol|TCP]] network. It was met with considerable enthusiasm in the Linux gaming community.<ref name="CNN">[http://www.cnn.com/2000/TECH/computing/04/12/linux.net.games.idg/index.html Open-source, networkable shooter has Linux gamers buzzing] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171222053224/http://www.cnn.com/2000/TECH/computing/04/12/linux.net.games.idg/index.html |date=2017-12-22 }} by Lee Anderson, April 12, 2000, [[CNN]]</ref>
The project was initiated by Flemming Frandsen in winter [[1999 in video gaming|1999]] after he had stumbled across Liero, which he liked so much that he decided to reimplement it under [[Linux]]. He abandoned the project five months later, due to being too busy for it. NiL was dead until the beginning of [[2004 in video gaming|2004]] when Christoph Brill, found out about the project and took over as maintainer. Thereafter Daniel Schneidereit joined the project as well, but soon left. Other contributors included Nils Thuerey, Harri Liusvaara, David Hewitt and Phil Howlett.
Development proceeded slowly as the project's [[source code]] became almost unmaintainable and NiL was lacking developers. By mid-2005 Alexander Kahl joined development, convinced Christoph to start over and re-think the whole concept of NiL, as the other Liero clone Gusanos already existed at that time. Development seems to have stopped around mid-2006.{{citation needed|date=March 2014}}
===OpenLieroX=== OpenLieroX is a remake of classic Liero, built from scratch in a new engine. It adds many features to the game, such as modding support, custom sprites, maps, and weapons, and online and lan play. The game also supports more than two players at once.
==Modification== ''Liero'' is a versatile game in terms of modification. All of its 40 weapons can be completely replaced with new ones that can be given different images and [[sound effects]] from the original set. The images of the worms themselves can be transformed into completely different characters, although their movement animations are less flexible regarding modification. The maps can be given permanent terrain other than rocks alone. Destroyable terrain can also be colored more than simply plain dirt. The AI can be modified to be harder or easier. Nearly the whole game can be converted into something entirely different, except for the main aspect having to do with slaughtering another player/AI.
==Reception and usage==
In 2006 Liero received a TopDog award from [[Home of the Underdogs]].<ref name="Hotu">[https://web.archive.org/web/20060614110741/http://www.the-underdogs.info/game.php?name=Liero Liero] on [[Home of the Underdogs|HOTU]] (2006)</ref> ''OpenLieroX'' has been positively reviewed by multiple gaming news sites.<ref name="bigdownload"/><ref name="Lanthrax"/><ref name="eGamer about OpenLieroX"/><ref>[http://tigsource.com/articles/2008/05/14/multiplayer-on-one-keyboard-6-lier-um-yeah Liero review with side note about OpenLieroX] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100202054332/http://tigsource.com/articles/2008/05/14/multiplayer-on-one-keyboard-6-lier-um-yeah |date=2010-02-02 }} on tigsource.com</ref><ref>[http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero_Xtreme Liero Xtreme entry in official Liero wiki] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090121184852/http://comser.liero.org.pl/wiki/index.php?title=Liero_Xtreme |date=January 21, 2009 }}</ref> In 2013 [[Derek Yu]]'s webpage TIGSource reviewed Liero v1.36 favorably.<ref name="TIG136">[https://www.tigsource.com/2014/02/14/liero-1-36/ liero-1-36] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160720004552/https://www.tigsource.com/2014/02/14/liero-1-36/ |date=2016-07-20 }} on TIGsource.com (2014-02-14)</ref>
The Liero variants NiL, Gusanos, and OpenLieroX were downloaded multiple hundred thousand times from [[Sourceforge]] alone between 2001 and 2016.<ref>[https://sourceforge.net/projects/gusanos/files/stats/timeline?dates=2003-07-10+to+2016-07-16 Gusanos - stats] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161004002045/https://sourceforge.net/projects/gusanos/files/stats/timeline?dates=2003-07-10+to+2016-07-16 |date=2016-10-04 }} on Sourceforge.net</ref><ref>[https://sourceforge.net/projects/openlierox/files/stats/timeline?dates=2004-10-16+to+2016-07-16 OpenLieroX - stats] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161004001943/https://sourceforge.net/projects/openlierox/files/stats/timeline?dates=2004-10-16+to+2016-07-16 |date=2016-10-04 }} on Sourceforge.net</ref><ref>[https://sourceforge.net/projects/nil/files/stats/timeline?dates=2001-07-10+to+2016-07-16 NiL Isn't Liero - stats] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161005151253/https://sourceforge.net/projects/nil/files/stats/timeline?dates=2001-07-10+to+2016-07-16 |date=2016-10-05 }} on [[Sourceforge.net]]</ref>
Calling Liero a "masterpiece", Liero was selected for a collection of 100 classical Finnish games, which were presented on the opening of the [[Finnish Museum of Games]] in [[Tampere]] in 2017.<ref>[https://www.aamulehti.fi/kulttuuri/muistatko-viela-nama-suomalaiset-klassikkopelit-nama-100-paasevat-tampereen-tulevaan-pelimuseoon-24144926/ Muistatko vielä nämä suomalaiset klassikkopelit? Nämä 100 pääsevät Tampereen pelimuseoon] on [[aamulehti]] (15.12.2016, [https://translate.google.de/translate?sl=fi&tl=en&js=y&ie=UTF-8&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aamulehti.fi%2Fkulttuuri%2Fmuistatko-viela-nama-suomalaiset-klassikkopelit-nama-100-paasevat-tampereen-tulevaan-pelimuseoon-24144926%2F&edit-text=&act=url English translation])</ref>

Sophie Ann Williamson }} '''Marianne Deborah Williamson''' (born July 8, 1952){{cite web|url=http://www.adze.com/Celebrities/MarianneWilliamson.htm|title=StarBios Report for Marianne Williamson|author=Knapp, Gwenn|year=2006|publisher=MOTTASIA Inc.|accessdate=2006-07-12|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061018034334/http://www.adze.com/Celebrities/MarianneWilliamson.htm|archivedate=2006-10-18|df=}} is an American spiritual teacher, author, lecturer, entrepreneur and activist. She has published twelve{{cite web |url= https://www.goodreads.com/author/list/17297.Marianne_Williamson |title= Books by Marianne Williamson |work= Good Reads |accessdate=2018-02-05}} books, including four ''New York Times'' number one bestsellers.{{cite web |url= https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/2016/07/10/religion-spirituality-and-faith/ |title= Religion, Spirituality and Faith |work= New York Times |accessdate=2018-02-05}} She is the founder of [[Project Angel Food]], a volunteer food delivery program that serves homebound people with [[HIV/AIDS|AIDS]] and other life challenging illnesses{{cite web |url= http://www.angelfood.org/site/PageServer?pagename=about_history |title= Our History |work= Project Angel Food |accessdate=2018-02-08}} in the [[Los Angeles]] area. She is also the co-founder{{cite web |url= https://peacealliance.org/who-we-are/history/ |title= History |work= The Peace Alliance |accessdate=2018-02-08}} of [[Peace Alliance|The Peace Alliance]], a nonprofit grassroots education and advocacy organization supporting peacebuilding projects. Williamson serves on the Board of Directors of the RESULTS organization, which works to end poverty in the United States and around the world. Williamson also produced the Sister Giant Conferences, highlighting the intersection of women and politics.{{cite web |url= https://www.huffpost.com/entry/marianne-williamson_b_1759887 |title= Gabrielle Bernstein Interviews Marianne Williamson: Sister Giant |work= Huffington Post |accessdate=2012-10-16}} ==Early life== Williamson was born in [[Houston]], Texas, in 1952.Munson, Zack. [http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,309771,00.html "Love Prophet"], ''[[Entertainment Weekly]],'' 1992 March 06 She is the youngest of three children of Samuel "Sam" Williamson, an immigration lawyer,Pristin, Terry. [http://articles.latimes.com/1992-02-16/entertainment/ca-4649_1_marianne-williamson "COVER STORY : The Power, the Glory, the Glitz : Marianne Williamson, an ex-nightclub singer, has attracted many in Hollywood with her blend of new-time religion and self-help--and alienated more than a few."], "[[Los Angeles Times]]," 1992 February 16 and his homemaker wife, Sophie Ann (Kaplan).Schindehette, Susan. [http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20112175,00.html/ "The Divine Miss W"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151022005438/http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20112175,00.html/ |date=2015-10-22 }}, ''[[People (magazine)|People]],'' 1992 March. 09{{cite web|url=http://jhvonline.com/sophie-ann-kaplan-williamson-p4164.htm|title=Jewish Herald-Voice|work=jhvonline.com}} After graduating from Houston's [[Bellaire High School (Texas)|Bellaire High School]], Williamson put in two years studying theater and philosophy at [[Pomona College]] in [[Claremont, California]] before dropping out in her Junior year and moving to New York City to pursue a career as a cabaret singer. In 1979, Williamson returned to Houston, where she ran a metaphysical bookstore. == Press and TV == She has been a guest on television programs such as ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'', ''[[Good Morning America]]'', and ''[[Real Time with Bill Maher]]''. In December 2006, a ''[[Newsweek]]'' magazine poll named her one of the fifty most influential baby boomers. Williamson bases her teaching and writing on a set of books called ''[[A Course in Miracles]]'', a non-religious self-study program of spiritual psychotherapy, based on universal spiritual themes.{{cite web |url= http://www.oprah.com/own-super-soul-sunday/marianne-williamson-on-whats-wrong-and-right-with-the-world-video |title= Marianne Williamson on What's Wrong—and Right—with the World |work= Oprah |date= 2012-12-29 |accessdate=2018-02-08}} == Publications == Williamson’s first book, ''A Return To Love'', was featured on the Oprah Winfrey television show in 1992 and remained on the New York Times bestseller list for 39 weeks.{{cite news |title=Faith: Marianne Williamson is Full of It |url=https://www.motherjones.com/politics/1997/11/faith-marianne-williamson-full-it/2/ |title=Marianne Williamson, Hollywood self-help guru, wants to heal Washington |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/marianne-williamson-hollywood-self-help-guru-wants-to-heal-washington/2014/03/11/378b0d02-a85f-11e3-b61e-8051b8b52d06_story.html?utm_term=.05cd9f8f5132 publications have been translated from English into other languages such as Spanish.{{cite web |url= https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/volver-al-amor-marianne-williamson/1013962663 |title= Volver al amor ( Return to Love) |work= Barnes & Noble | |accessdate=2018-02-08}} ==Social Change Work== ===HIV/AIDS Advocacy=== ====Centers for Living==== In response to the HIV/AIDS crises in the 1980s, Marianne founded the Los Angeles and Manhattan Centers for Living, which served as a refuge and non-medical support for people with HIV/AIDS. There they could connect with a variety of psychological and emotional resources, as well as community of support. She has said of that time that "there was so much love, because there was nothing to hold onto but love."{{cite news |title=Marianne Williamson Aims to Defeat Henry Waxman, and Save Washington's Soul |url=https://www.laweekly.com/news/marianne-williamson-aims-to-defeat-henry-waxman-and-save-washingtons-soul-4316162 |date=1 January 2014}} ====Project Angel Food==== In 1989, Marianne launched [[Project Angel Food]] to build off the work of the Centers for Living. Originally launched to support HIV/AIDS patients, Project Angel Food expanded its outreach and currently cooks and delivers more than 12,000 meals each week, free of charge, to the homes of men, women and children affected by various life-threatening illnesses.{{cite news |title=Project Angel Food's Angel Awards benefit, featuring Charo and Cheyenne Jackson, raises $650,000 | url=http://www.latimes.com/fashion/la-ig-project-angel-food-angel-awards-20180820-htmlstory.html |publisher=LA Times |date=2018-08-20}} The organization's food and nutrition services, including medically tailored meals and nutritional counseling, help underserved people throughout Los Angeles County who are too sick to shop or cook for themselves. In 2017, Project Angel Food served its 11 millionth meal.{{cite news |title=Project Angel Food serves 11 millionth meal |url=http://www.losangelesblade.com/2017/11/28/project-angel-food-serves-11-millionth-meal/ |publisher=Los Angeles Blade |date=2018-11-28}} ===Women’s advocacy=== Williamson has worked on behalf of women’s empowerment issues for decades. In 1993 she published her #1 NYT bestseller, A Woman’s Worth.{{cite news |title=BEST SELLERS: July 11, 1993 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1993/07/11/books/best-sellers-july-11-1993.html |publisher=New York Times |date=1993-07-11}} Publisher’s Weekly said of the book: “Williamson gives sound, empowering advice on relationships, work, love, sex and childrearing.”{{cite news |title=A Woman's Worth |url=https://www.publishersweekly.com/978-0-679-42218-1 |publisher=Publishers Weekly}} In 2010, Marianne launched a series of Sister Giant conferences, trainings and events to support individuals – particularly women – who want to increase their efficacy as activists and/or run for office. Of the initiative she has said, “I want to be a cheerleader for women who have never even considered running for office or being involved in a campaign, but who in the quietness of their hearts might think, ‘Why not me?’” The events have focused on how to better address many social issues, including: child poverty, low levels of female representation in office, campaign finance reform, high levels of mass incarceration, among other issues.{{cite web |url= https://www.huffpost.com/entry/marianne-williamson_b_1759887 |title= Gabrielle Bernstein Interviews Marianne Williamson: Sister Giant |work= Huffington Post |accessdate=2012-10-16}}{{cite web |title=The History of Sister Giant |url= http://sistergiant.com/history-of-sister-giant/}} ===''Healing the Soul of America''=== In 1997 Williamson published her book ''Healing the Soul of America'' (hardcover originally titled ''The Healing of America'') and began a more robust political engagement. In this book, Williamson laid out plans to “transform the American political consciousness and encourage powerful citizen involvement to heal our society.”{{cite web |title=Healing the Soul of America - 20th Anniversary Edition |url=http://www.simonandschuster.com/books/Healing-the-Soul-of-America-20th-Anniversary-Edition/Marianne-Williamson/9781982101565 |website=Simon and Schuster}} She wrote in the book, “It is a task of our generation to recreate the American [[politeia]], to awaken from our culture of distraction and re-engage the process of democracy with soulfulness and hope. Yes, we see there are problems in the world. But we believe in a universal force that, when activated by the human heart, has the power to make all things right. Such is the divine authority of love: to renew the heart, renew the nations, and ultimately, renew the world.”{{cite web |title=How To Heal Yourself And The World Around You |url=http://www.oprah.com/own-super-soul-sunday/book-excerpt-healing-the-soul-of-america-by-marianne-williamson/all#ixzz5QRNlTT8a |website=Oprah.com}} Patricia Holt of the San Francisco Chronicle called it “A huge and wondrous surprise....The Healing of America somehow makes us proud to be Americans, because every hope for democracy seems newly within our grasp.”{{cite news |title=BOOKS -- The Spiritual Side Of U.S. Politics / Williamson urges rethinking of roles |url=https://www.sfgate.com/books/article/BOOKS-The-Spiritual-Side-Of-U-S-Politics-2825611.php |publisher=San Francisco Chronicle |date=1997-10-14}} A 20th anniversary edition was published in 2018. ===Peacebuilding=== In 2004, Marianne co-founded [[Peace Alliance|The Peace Alliance]], a non-profit grassroots education and advocacy organization.{{cn|date=November 2018}} ===Poverty=== For years Marianne was a member of the Board of Directors and remains a public supporter of [[Results (organisation)|RESULTS]], an organization aiming to create the political will to end hunger and poverty around the world. It lobbies public officials, does research, and works with the media and the public to addresses the causal issues of poverty. RESULTS has 100 U.S. local chapters and works in six other countries.{{cite web |title=Turning Compassion into a Political Force |url=https://www.results.org/events/IC_2012_Marianne_Williamson |website=Results.org}} ===Love America Tour=== Starting in the winter of 2018, Marianne began touring the United States as part of her ''Love America Tour'', discussing how she believes "a revolution in consciousness paves the way to both personal and national renewal." About the tour she shared: “Our own disconnection from the political process, lack of knowledge of how our system operates, lack of understanding of our history, and confusion about many of the issues that confront us now, have led in too many cases to a dangerous emotional disconnection between our country and ourselves.”{{cite news |title=Marianne Williamson bringing her 'Love America' tour to Detroit |url=https://www.freep.com/story/news/local/michigan/detroit/2018/05/15/marianne-williamson-bringing-love-america-tour-detroit/610713002/ |publisher=Detroit Free Press |date=2018-05-15}} {{cite web |title=Tour Dates |url=http://sistergiant.com/tour-dates/ |website=Sistergiant.com}} ==Political career== ===2014 US House campaign=== Williamson ran for the seat of [[California's 33rd congressional district]] in [[United States House of Representatives elections in California, 2014|2014]]. On her motivation for running, she has stated: “America has gone off the democratic rails. A toxic brew of shrinking civil liberties and expanded corporate influence are poisoning our democracy.“ Her core message was that “humanitarian values should replace economic values as the ordering principle of our civilization.” https://web.archive.org/web/20140225002934/http://www.marianneforcongress.com/ Prominent elected and public officials endorsed her campaign, including: Frmr. Governors [[Jennifer Granholm]] and [[Jesse Ventura]]; Frmr, Congressmembers [[Dennis Kucinich]], and [[Alan Grayson]]; and [[Van Jones]], among many others.{{cite web |title=Marianne Williamson |url=http://mwfc-timwayne.nationbuilder.com/endorsements}} [[Alanis Morissette]] wrote and performed her campaign theme song, entitled ''Today''.{{cite news |title=Alanis Morissette cuts campaign song for Calif. candidate |url=http://thehill.com/blogs/ballot-box/house-races/205332-alanis-morissette-cuts-campaign-ad-for-long-shot-candidate |publisher=The Hill |date=2014-05-06}} She campaigned on a broad array of progressive issues, including: greater access to high-quality education and free college; child poverty; economic justice; climate change & renewable energy; campaign finance reform; universal health care; criminal justice reform; ending perpetual war and increasing investments in peacebuilding; women’s reproductive rights; and LGBTQ equality among others.{{cite news |title=Marianne Williamson, New-Age Guru, Seeks Congressional Seat |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/14/us/politics/marianne-williamson-new-age-guru-seeks-congressional-seat.html |publisher=New York Times |date=2013-11-13}}{{cite web |title=Issues |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226020125/http://www.marianneforcongress.com:80/issues |website=Wayback Machine}}{{cite news |title=Marianne Williamson Aims to Defeat Henry Waxman, and Save Washington's Soul |url=https://www.laweekly.com/news/marianne-williamson-aims-to-defeat-henry-waxman-and-save-washingtons-soul-4316162 |publisher=LA Weekly |date=2014-01-16}} She finished fourth out of 16 candidates{{cite news |title=Marianne Williamson, Hollywood's Favorite New Age Guru, Backs Bernie Sanders for President |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/marianne-williamson-hollywoods-favorite-new-792820 |publisher=Hollywood Reporter |date=2015-05-01}} with 14,335 votes for 13.2% of the vote. Williamson said of the process and its outcome: “This conversation of a politics of conscience, a politics of the heart, is much bigger than any one woman winning a congressional seat. And if that woman loses, the conversation goes on. My losing the congressional seat is small; what’s big is the larger conversation… you impact the ethers, and that energy goes somewhere.”{{cite web |title=Oprah to Marianne Williamson: "How Important Was the Win for You?" |url=http://www.oprah.com/own-super-soul-sunday/oprah-to-marianne-williamson-how-important-was-the-win-video#ixzz5W1Tzz8SN |website=Oprah.com |accessdate=2014-11-02}} ===2020 presidential campaign=== On August 2, 2018, [[The Guardian]] reported that she was exploring the possibility of a [[United States presidential election, 2020|presidential run in 2020]] for the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]].https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/aug/02/marianne-williamson-new-age-author-looking-into-presidential-run?CMP=share_btn_tw On November 15, 2018, Williamson announced that she was forming an [[exploratory committee]] for a presidential run.{{cite web |title=Marianne Williamson on Twitter |url=https://twitter.com/marwilliamson/status/1063229938679996417 |website=Twitter |language=en|quote=Announcing the formation of an exploratory committee for a presidential run in 2020. From my heart to yours...}}Thompson, Alex. (November 16, 2018). "Oprah pal and spirituality guru plans 2020 run." [https://www.politico.com/story/2018/11/16/oprah-pal-williamson-2020-run-996174 Politico website] Retrieved 17 November 2018. ===Political positions=== ====Racial reconciliation==== Williamson has been a public advocate in the arenas of racial justice and race relations. She is known for leading public apologies for slavery and has encouraged paying reparations for slavery.{{cite news |title=Marianne Williamson asked white people to apologize. She got it right. |url=https://www.houstonchronicle.com/local/gray-matters/article/How-to-heal-racism-It-starts-with-an-apology-12510316.php |publisher=Houston Chronicle |date=2019-01-19}}{{cite news |title=Why we need both a national apology and reparations to heal the wounds of racism |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2018/04/04/why-we-need-both-a-national-apology-and-reparations-to-heal-the-wounds-of-racism/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.ce5cf60ad8f6 |publisher=Washington Post |date=2018-04-04}} Marianne has also worked in support of reforming our criminal justice system.{{cite web |title=Race and Repentance in America |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/marianne-williamson/race-repentance-and-repar_b_5689876.html |website=Huffington Post |accessdate=2014-08-08}} ==Personal life== Williamson identifies as Jewish, and was briefly married. '''Mauricio Suárez''' is a Spanish anglophone philosopher who specialises in philosophy of science and philosophy of physics. He earned his BSc in astrophysics from the [[University of Edinburgh]] (1991), and his MSc and PhD in philosophy of science from the [[London School of Economics]] (1992 and 1997 respectively). He currently holds the Chair (Cátedra) in Logic and Philosophy of Science at [[Complutense University of Madrid]].
His previous appointments include:
*Junior Lecturer in Philosophy of Physics, [[University of Oxford]] (1995-6) *Teaching and Research Fellow, [[University of St Andrews]] (1996-7) *Postdoctoral Research Fellow, [[Northwestern University]] (1997-8) *Permanent Lecturer, [[University of Bristol]] (1997–2003) *Associate Tenured Professor, [[Complutense University of Madrid]] (2002-2016)
In addition he was Junior Research Fellow at [[Wolfson College, Oxford|Wolfson College]], [[Oxford University|Oxford]]; a visiting scholar at the [[University of Sydney]] (2003) and [[Harvard University]] (2007, 2009, 2011), and a Visiting Professorial Fellow at the [[Institute of Philosophy, University of London|Institute of Philosophy]], [[School of Advanced Study]], [[London University]] (2012). He has published on models, representation, causal inference, propensities, and the philosophy of quantum mechanics. He edited ''Fictions in Science'' (Routledge, 2009), ''Probabilities, Causes and Propensities in Physics'' (Springer, 2011), and coedited ''EPSA07: Launch of the European Philosophy of Science Association'', vol. I and II (Springer, 2010). He was one of the founders of the [[European Philosophy of Science Association]] and served as its Vicepresident from 2009 to 2011.
== External links == * [https://www.ucm.es/dpto_logica/mauricio_suarez Mauricio Suárez website] at [[Complutense University of Madrid]] * [http://www.lse.ac.uk/researchAndExpertise/Experts/profile.aspx?KeyValue=m.suarez%40lse.ac.uk Mauricio Suárez website] at [[London School of Economics]] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110415174958/http://www.epsa.ac.at/ The European Philosophy of Science Association (EPSA)]
